etymology.description: 岭(嶺) (lǐng, "ridge; mountain range") + 南(南) (nán, "south") = region south of the mountain range
etymology.interpretation: The term 岭南(嶺南) (lǐngnán, "south of the mountains") refers to the geographic region located south of the Nanling Mountain Range in China. This area plays a significant role in Chinese history and culture, being known for its unique climate and cultural influences, distinct from North China.

examples.english: I want to travel to Lingnan.

examples.chinese: 岭南风光迷人(嶺南風光迷人)，吸引了众多摄影师(吸引了眾多攝影師)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐngnán fēngguāng mírén, xīyǐnle zhòngduō shèyǐngshī.
examples.english: The beautiful scenery of Lingnan attracts many photographers.

examples.chinese: 岭南料理独具风味(嶺南料理獨具風味)，让人流连忘返(讓人流連忘返)。
examples.pinyin: Lǐngnán liàolǐ dújù fēngwèi, ràng rén liúliánwàngfǎn.
examples.english: Lingnan cuisine has a unique taste that makes people reluctant to leave.
